title: Moss & Lichen Quiz
description: Discover the tiny but mighty world of mosses and lichens! Test your knowledge of these ancient, fascinating organisms.

questions.question: What is a lichen actually composed of?
options: A fungus and an alga living together

questions.question: Which type of moss is commonly used in floral arrangements and terrariums for its feathery texture?
Spanish Moss, which hangs from trees in the American South, is actually not a moss at all. What is it?
Sphagnum moss is commercially important because it is harvested and sold as what garden product?
Lichens are often used as indicators of what environmental condition?
What is the common saying about which side of a tree moss tends to grow on in the Northern Hemisphere?
"Reindeer Moss" is actually a type of what?
Mosses lack which plant structure that most other plants have?
What color does the lichen called "British Soldiers" (Cladonia cristatella) display on its tips?
In Japanese gardening, moss is prized and cultivated. What famous Kyoto temple is known as the "Moss Temple"?
Which type of lichen grows in a leaf-like, flat, lobed form on rocks and tree bark?
Peat bogs formed from Sphagnum moss can preserve organic material for how long?
What do mosses use instead of true roots to anchor themselves to surfaces?
Lichens can survive in extremely harsh environments. Where have scientists found living lichens?
What is the traditional use of Oakmoss lichen (Evernia prunastri) in the fragrance industry?
options: As a base note fixative in perfumes
